snippet: A judge appeared willing to consider the possibility that he had been wrong to sign off on the very wiretaps that had begun the inquiry.
abstract: Judge Steven Barrett, who authorized a series of wiretaps on phones of police union officials in Bronx in 2009, appears now willing to consider possibility that he his decision was wrong; lawyers for more than a dozen New York Police Dept officers are asking for criminal charges related to ticket fixing be thrown out, on grounds that the wiretaps that form foundation of cases should not have been granted.
lead_paragraph: A judge appeared willing to consider the possibility that he had been wrong to sign off on the very wiretaps that had begun the inquiry.

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
